item.title: Coronavirus: 'Not smart' memo shows Amazon's union stance
item.description: The firm's lawyer says his comments were personal, spoken out of emotional frustration.

item.title: Zoom 'unsuitable' for government secrets, researchers say
item.description: The meeting app used by Cabinet has odd encryption and sends data through China, researchers say.

item.title: Coronavirus: Garden centres switch to virtual personal shopping
item.description: Plants are being sold via livestreams, emails and social media as lockdown forces traders to close.

item.title: Coronavirus: Google reveals travel habits during the pandemic
item.description: It will regularly provide updates as to what types of places people are going to during the outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus threatens the next generation of smartphones
item.description: The latest smartphones might be delayed due to disrupted supply chains and shoppers staying at home.

item.title: Bafta Games Awards: Outer Wilds wins Best Game
item.description: Outer Wilds and Disco Elysium both win three golden masks at this year's Bafta Games Awards.

item.title: Zoom boss apologises for security issues and promises fixes
item.description: The firm will freeze all new feature development to concentrate on fixing security and privacy issues.

item.title: Google uses AI to enhance video call audio
item.description: The new system realistically fills short gaps in conversations where drops previously occurred.

item.title: Amazon wins trademark battle over Davidoff perfume
item.description: European Court judges that Amazon is not responsible for a Marketplace seller's trademark infringement.

item.title: Coronavirus: How China's using surveillance to tackle outbreak
item.description: China is using its high tech system to tackle the outbreak, but is the state interference justified?

item.title: The robot car enforcing lockdown and other news
item.description: BBC Click's Omar Mehtab looks at the best of the week's technology stories.

item.title: Robot brings Hastings gallery art into people's homes
item.description: The Hastings Contemporary is offering virtual tours during the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: How robots have joined the battle against coronavirus
item.description: From taking temperatures remotely to helping with hand washing, robots are helping with healthcare.

item.title: The cello playing robot and other tech news
item.description: BBC Click's Paul Carter looks at some of the best tech stories of the week.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: Clubbers go online for music
item.description: With the coronavirus lockdown bringing normal nightlife to an end, some enterprising DJs are going online.

item.title: Houseparty: How safe is Epic Games' video chat app?
item.description: Security experts back owner's assertion that chat app is not hacking other products.

item.title: 'The phone slipped into the bath': Conference call tales
item.description: How to avoid some of the pitfalls of teleconferencing and how it is changing the way we meet and do business.

item.title: Coronavirus: The sports turning to gaming during lockdown
item.description: From boxing to Formula 1, sports are reinventing the way they are played during coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: Here's how you can stop bad information from going viral
item.description: Experts are calling on the public to practise ‘information hygiene’ to help stop the spread of falsehoods online.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are ventilators and why are they important?
item.description: The lives of some Covid-19 patients may depend upon medical ventilators - here are the basics of how they work.

item.title: Step-by-step guide: How to video call your family
item.description: This guide will show you how to make and receive video calls on a variety of devices.
